topic.title: Add SNMP Alert
topic.keywords: alert destination community string inform message SNMP alert add

content.p: To set up your new SNMP alert's information, use the following fields.

ul.li: udp6 or udpv6 or udpipv6—For ipv6 udp traps
tcp—For IPv4 tcp traps ( only for snmpv3)

tcp6 or tcpv6 or tcpipv6—For ipv6 tcp traps (only for snmpv3)
Destination:
IPv4 address—###.###.###.### where ### ranges from 0 to 255
IPv6 address—####:####:####:####:####:####:####:#### where #### ranges from 0 to FFFF. A compressed version of the same IPv6 address is also supported.

DNS name—1 to 64 characters including all alphanumeric characters and the dash (-).
Port:
The port number is any valid and available udp/tcp port number in the range of [1;65535] (both inclusive). If port is specified for an IPv6 address, the IPv6 address must be enclosed in [...]; for example, [####:####::####]:162 to specify port 162.

td.p: The management station IP address or DNS name. Alert destination can be specified in [protocol:]destination[:port] format. Both protocol and port are optional parameters.
0 to 20 characters including all printable characters and the space
A text string that acts as a password. It is used to authenticate messages that are sent between HP management server and Onboard Administrator.
NOTE: While in FIPS Mode ON/DEBUG, the SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 are disabled, and you can create only SNMPv3 traps.

content.p: To configure the following fields, select the SNMPv3 check box:

ul.li: User—The SNMP user account to be used to send the trap/inform. Desired user-engineID must be created before the alert destination can be added.

Security—The security level used to send trap/inform. Security level options: No authorization or encryption (noAuthNoPriv), Authorization but no encryption (authNoPriv), and Authorization and Encryption (authPriv). The default is authNoPriv.

Inform Message—If an inform message is specified, the agent expects to a receive notification from the management application that the trap has been received. The agent retries to send traps if no inform acknowledgment is received. Alerts with Inform Message enable must have a remote user, which is available on a management solution.

content.p: To proceed with adding the SNMP alert, click Add Alert.
